headline.main: Air Transat to Compensate for Canceled Flight, Drunk Pilots
headline.print_headline: Air Transat to Compensate for Canceled Flight, Drunk Pilots

docs.snippet: Air Transat's president says the carrier will compensate passengers booked on a flight that was canceled when two pilots were arrested on suspicion of drunkenness....
docs.lead_paragraph: Air Transat's president says the carrier will compensate passengers booked on a flight that was canceled when two pilots were arrested on suspicion of drunkenness.

headline.main: Exclusive: Possible Early North Korean Nuclear Site Found-Report
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Possible Early North Korean Nuclear Site Found-Report

docs.snippet: A U.S. policy institute said it may have located a secret facility used by North Korea in the early stages of building its program to enrich uranium for nuclear weapons, which if confirmed would be critical to the success of any future nuclear dea...
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. policy institute said it may have located a secret facility used by North Korea in the early stages of building its program to enrich uranium for nuclear weapons, which if confirmed would be critical to the success of any future nuclear deal, according to a report seen by Reuters on Thursday.

headline.main: Brazilian Scientists ID Common Mosquito as a Zika Source
headline.print_headline: Brazilian Scientists ID Common Mosquito as a Zika Source

docs.snippet: Brazilian researchers said Thursday that they have found that another species of mosquito is able to transmit the Zika virus to humans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazilian researchers said Thursday that they have found that another species of mosquito is able to transmit the Zika virus to humans.

headline.main: 1st Bitcoin Securities Fraud Case Ends in 18-Month Sentence
headline.print_headline: 1st Bitcoin Securities Fraud Case Ends in 18-Month Sentence

docs.snippet: A Texas man who carried out what authorities said was the first federal bitcoin securities fraud to be prosecuted was sentenced on Thursday to 18 months in prison....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Texas man who carried out what authorities said was the first federal bitcoin securities fraud to be prosecuted was sentenced on Thursday to 18 months in prison.

headline.main: Report Details Affair That Led to US Attorney's Downfall
headline.print_headline: Report Details Affair That Led to US Attorney's Downfall

docs.snippet: The federal prosecutor whose accusation of sexual harassment led U.S. Attorney for Oregon Amanda Marshall to resign told investigators he reported her behavior because it was interfering with his ability to eat, sleep and work, and he worried abou...
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal prosecutor whose accusation of sexual harassment led U.S. Attorney for Oregon Amanda Marshall to resign told investigators he reported her behavior because it was interfering with his ability to eat, sleep and work, and he worried about losing his job.

headline.main: Shell to Trim Jobs in Deep Waters of the Gulf of Mexico
headline.print_headline: Shell to Trim Jobs in Deep Waters of the Gulf of Mexico

docs.snippet: Oil giant Shell said Thursday that it will be cutting about 190 jobs from its deep-water Gulf of Mexico operations....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oil giant Shell said Thursday that it will be cutting about 190 jobs from its deep-water Gulf of Mexico operations.

headline.main: 2nd Former Ole Miss Student Sentenced in Statue Vandalism
headline.print_headline: 2nd Former Ole Miss Student Sentenced in Statue Vandalism

docs.snippet: A former University of Mississippi student was sentenced Thursday to a year's probation plus 50 hours of community service for placing a noose on the statue of the school's first black student....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former University of Mississippi student was sentenced Thursday to a year's probation plus 50 hours of community service for placing a noose on the statue of the school's first black student.

headline.main: Visa Earnings Fall Due to Costs Tied to Visa Europe Purchase
headline.print_headline: Visa Earnings Fall Due to Costs Tied to Visa Europe Purchase

docs.snippet: Credit and debit card processor Visa Inc. said its fiscal third-quarter earnings fell 76 percent from a year ago, largely due to the cost of completing its purchase of its operations in Europe....
docs.lead_paragraph: Credit and debit card processor Visa Inc. said its fiscal third-quarter earnings fell 76 percent from a year ago, largely due to the cost of completing its purchase of its operations in Europe.

headline.main: U.N. Memo on South Sudan Leaves Out Criticism of Britain
headline.print_headline: U.N. Memo on South Sudan Leaves Out Criticism of Britain

docs.snippet: A final United Nations memo on Britain, Germany, Sweden and Jordan's withdrawals of police from a peacekeeping mission in South Sudan without telling the world body, left out draft language questioning Britain's Security Council veto power....
docs.lead_paragraph: A final United Nations memo on Britain, Germany, Sweden and Jordan's withdrawals of police from a peacekeeping mission in South Sudan without telling the world body, left out draft language questioning Britain's Security Council veto power.

headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Thursday
headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Thursday

docs.snippet: Stocks fell Thursday after a mixed set of earnings reports put at least a temporary halt to the market's record-setting run. Airlines had some of the sharpest drops on worries that falling fares will hurt their profits....
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks fell Thursday after a mixed set of earnings reports put at least a temporary halt to the market's record-setting run. Airlines had some of the sharpest drops on worries that falling fares will hurt their profits.
